Generation IV.Diamond: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
Generation IV.Pearl: It once lived in the tropics. To avoid the cold, it lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat.
Generation IV.Platinum: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.

Generation V.Black: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.
Generation V.White: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.
Generation V.Black 2: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.
Generation V.White 2: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.

Generation VI.X: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
Generation VI.Y: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.

Generation VII.Sun: It lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat. Even so, when the weather gets cold, it will huddle close with others of its kind.
Generation VII.Moon: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It reacts to anything that moves—flies right at it and bites it. Sometimes it injures itself, but it doesn't care too much.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its original home is an area much hotter than Alola. If you're planning to live with one, your heating bill will soar.

Generation VIII.Sword: Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides of caves heated by geothermal energy. This way, Gible can stay warm even during a blizzard.
Generation VIII.Shield: Gible attacks anything that moves, and it drags whatever it catches into the crevice that is its lair. Despite the big mouth, Gible's stomach is small.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It once lived in the tropics. To avoid the cold, it lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within a few days.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
Generation IX.Violet: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.

Generation IV.HeartGold: Safari Zone (tall grass in Rocky Beach with 49 Plains points and 49 Peak points)
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Safari Zone (tall grass in Rocky Beach with 49 Plains points and 49 Peak points)

Generation V.Black 2: Received from Benga in Floccesy Town after he is defeated at Black Tower ( Shiny )

Generation VIII.Shield Expansion Pass: Tunnel to the Top Giant's Bed , Path to the Peak , Ballimere Lake , Three-Point Pass , Frigid Sea ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Wayward Cave Grand Underground - Riverbank Cave , Fountainspring Cave , Still-Water Cavern (After defeating Candice )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Wayward Cave Grand Underground - Riverbank Cave , Fountainspring Cave , Still-Water Cavern (After defeating Candice )
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Coronet Highlands : Wayward Cave , Clamberclaw Cliffs , massive mass outbreaks Alabaster Icelands : Avalanche Slopes Coronet Highlands: Wayward Cave, Clamberclaw Cliffs Shaking ore deposits Alabaster Icelands: Avalanche Slopes Shaking ore deposits

Generation IX.Scarlet: South Province: Alfornada Cavern West Province: Area One , Area Two Area Zero Tera Raid Battles ( 3★ )
Generation IX.Violet: South Province: Alfornada Cavern West Province: Area One , Area Two Area Zero Tera Raid Battles ( 3★ )
